note.p: Shipping line. Established in 1845 by William James Lamport and George Holt, with early sailing ships trading with North and South America and India, and a regular Mediterranean service running from the 1850s. Started acquiring steamships in 1857; the Liverpool, Brazil and River Plate Steam Navigation Company was formed to operate services to the east coast of South America, 1865; the Société de Navigation Royale Belge Sud-Americaine started to operate the Belgian Mail contract to South America in 1877. Sold to Owen Philipps and became part of the Kylsant shipping empire, 1911.
